alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 16 at 7:08PM CDT until April 17 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Temporary Decrease In The Snow Early This Evening... .The snow has temporarily diminished in intensity across much of the area early this evening. However, another band of heavy snow is expected to develop after dark across portions of north-central into western Wisconsin. Rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour can be expected again in the next band of heavy snow. This will be enough for rapid accumulation to occur and for roads to become snow covered and slippery. In addition, the heavy, wet snow combined with gusty winds could cause some power outages and tree damage to occur. Snowfall reports along the Mississippi River under the heavy snow band from the afternoon indicate amounts of 3 to 8 inches fell. As more snow falls overnight, we may lose a few inches due to melting and compaction, however, storm totals of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts are expected through Monday morning. Travel tonight and into Monday will be significant hampered and some roads may be impassable until plowed. In addition, strong winds of 35 to 45 mph will further reduce visibilities during the times of heavier snow and a mix of freezing rain is possible north of U.S. Highway 10 in central Wisconsin this evening before transitioning to all snow. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 15 inches Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, southwest and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 1 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon
